==Chinese==

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|气|t1=gas|丿|t2=one|ls=ic}}. Also a {{liushu|psc|nocap=y}}, where {{zh-l|丿}} acts as the phonetic component. Compare {{zh-l|*氘|deuterium}} and {{zh-l|*氚|tritium}}.

===Etymology===
From {{zh-l|丿|left falling stroke}} from the glyph, possibly influenced by {{cog|NL.|protium}}. In Mandarin, it is pronounced in the first tone by analogy with {{zh-l|氘|deuterium}} and {{zh-l|氚|tritium}}.
